results.title: Philby, Burgess & Maclean
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions, Jeremy Wallington and Gordon Flemyng
results.brief_description: During the 1950’s the world was shocked by the defection to the Soviet Union of Guy Burgess and Donald Maclean, highly placed officials in the diplomatic service. Years later with the web slowly closing around him, Kim Philby defected also. Although in line for the Number Two job in the British Secret Service, he was also a full colonel in the KGB, whom he had secretly served throughout his career. This excellent dramatisation recreates the factual evidence which stunned a nation

results.title: Philately
results.brief_description: Introduces a study of postage stamps with a glimpse of some other outlets of man’s collecting instinct. Continues with a history of the development of courier and postal services from the time of the pharaohs and the Roman Empire to the modern world system of communication.

results.title: Philadelphia with love
results.creator_credit: Nassau Film Productions, Bell Telephone Company of Pennsylvania and James A. Love
results.brief_description: Shows the modern city of Philadelphia, a beneficiary of urban renewal, a city where sports and cultural opportunities are readily available. Describes the parks, museums, institutions of higher learning, the city government and the office of the mayor. “Philadelphia with love” sung by Sergio Franchi. Narration by Joel Craeger.

results.title: Philadelphia
results.creator_credit: Clinica Estetico, Edward Saxon and Jonathan Demme
results.brief_description: In this emotionally-charged film about prejudices and human frailty, Tom Hanks stars as Andrew Beckett, a brilliant young lawyer battling AIDS, who is suddenly fired by his prestigious firm. Fighting for both his life and his professional reputation, Beckett hires street-wise personal injury attorney, Joe Miller (Denzel Washington in a power-house performance), to represent him as he sues the firm for wrongful termination. Seperated from Beckett by a deep social and cultural chasm, Miller has to challenge his own prejudices and fears if he is to take on the system and win. Honoured with an Academy Award for his brilliant performance, Tom Hanks leads a strong cast which includes Jason Robards, Mary Steenburgen and Antonio Banderas as Hank’s lover.

results.title: Phil Mulloy: extreme animation (D)
results.brief_description: A series of short animated films that display Phil Mulloy’s darkly comedic take on humanity combined with deliberately simple, shambolic animation. The films regularly contain scenes that, to most viewers, are shocking and confronting, daring the audience to challenge and question their own preconceived ideas on decency and right and wrong. Mulloy attacks Christianity and authority figures with gusto, arguing that they repress basic human needs and instincts. The animation confronts too, with its stark representation of the world as black and white dirty landscapes and with humans constantly baring jagged teeth. The series of shorts displayed in the title are “The Ten Commandments”, “The History of the world”, and “Cowboys”. Of the longer individual works, “The Wind of change” is the most poignant, with the film narrated by Mulloy’s musical collaborator, violinist Alex Balanescu. The story tells Balanescu’s life story, looking at the crushed individuality suffered by his people in the Soviet Union, and his musical repression in the ‘Free World’. The films contain extremely strong sexual references and violence.

results.title: Phiguring out acids and bases
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, Deborah Lawther, Glen Foster, Trish Pilley and Shane Mulcahy
results.brief_description: Examines the acids and bases in everyday use and develops the idea of ph measurment both quantitatively and qualitatively as a measure of concentration.This program presents historical developments of the proton/theory and pH notation. Practical applications of pH testing and adjustments are also covered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, Deborah Lawther, Glen Foster, Trish Pilley and Shane Mulcahy

results.title: Phenomena
results.brief_description: Creepy thriller from horror maestro Dario Argento features a strong performance from a very young Jennifer Connelly as an imperilled schoolgirl (also named Jennifer) who undergoes a series of frightening encounters whilst boarding at a Swiss finishing school. After experiencing nightmares that provide insight into a serial killer’s movements, Jennifer’s talent for communicating with insects links her to bug specialist Dr McGregor, with whom she aims to unmask the murderer. Engaging in the tropes of the genre - and using his trademark gore and gross-out aesthetics - Argento provides an array of thrills, scares and narrative twists all backed by a rock soundtrack. Uncut, uncensored widescreen edition. Also known as “Creepers” (US title).

results.title: Phase one: Prince Charles Mountains
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Roger Hayne
results.brief_description: Shows the work of a topographical and geological survey of the Prince Charles Mountains, Antarctica in 1969. Under summer conditions the land forms are visible, and valuable data is collected and evaluated.

results.title: Phase diagrams
results.brief_description: The construction and use of phase diagrams and why they are a critical part of understanding how igneous rocks form. Deals with the construction and use of phase diagrams. Demonstrates how a simple diagram can be built and extended to three component systems. Step by step a three-dimensional phase diagram using three binary eutectics is constructed. Shows how phase diagrams can contribute to our understanding of how igneous rocks form, and demonstrates both basalt and granite systems.
